meanings.definition: Proceeding in a gradual, subtle way, but with harmful effects.
meanings.sent1: The insidious virus spread silently through the population.
meanings.sent2: The insidious plan to undermine the project was finally revealed.
meanings.sent3: The insidious squirrel stole all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her insidious smile hid her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The insidious whispers of doubt clouded his mind like a fog.

meanings.sent1: The insidious fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She fell victim to the insidious lies of her so-called friend.
meanings.sent3: The insidious cat pretended to be asleep to catch the mouse off guard.
meanings.sent4: His insidious tactics in the game made him a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The insidious plot of the novel kept readers on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: Operating or proceeding in an inconspicuous or seemingly harmless way but actually with grave effect.
meanings.sent1: The insidious leak in the pipe caused extensive damage over time.
meanings.sent2: The insidious software quietly collected personal data without consent.
meanings.sent3: The insidious plant looked innocent but was actually poisonous.
meanings.sent4: The insidious rumor spread like wildfire, causing chaos in the town.
meanings.sent5: The insidious change in policy had far-reaching consequences for the company.
